title: Stevie_Nicks-Enchanted-3CD-(Retail)-1998-HHI
description:
Artist......: Stevie nicks                                                      
               Album.......: Enchanted                                                         
               Grabber     : EAC                                                               
               Encoder     : LAME v3.90.3                                                      
               Release Date: Apr-28-1998                                                       
               Rip Date....: Feb-22-2008                                                       
               Genre.......: Rock                                                              
               Quality     : VBRkbps / 44.1kHz / Joint-Stereo                                  
               Playtime    : CD1: 65:51 CD2: 72:31 CD3: 73:46                                  
               Ripper      : Happy Hacker Industries                                           
               CD Songs    : CD1: 15 CD2: 15 CD3: 16                                           
               Label.......: Modern                                                            
               Album Info..:                                                                   
                                                                                               
          The first two discs of ENCHANTED contain tracks from BELLA DONNA, THE WILD HEART,    
          ROCK A LITTLE, THE OTHER SIDE OF THE MIRROR and STREET ANGEL. The third disc contains
          collector&#039;s items that include material from soundtracks, other artist&#039;s albums and  
          one song from the BUCKINGHAM/NICKS album ("Crying In The Night").                    
                                                                                               
          Personnel includes: Stevie Nicks (vocals, guitar, harmonica, piano, synthesizer,     
          percussion); Lindsey Buckingham (vocals, guitar, percussion); Tom Petty (vocals,     
          guitar); Sandy Stewart (vocals, piano, synthesizer); Don Henley (vocals, drums);     
          Kenny Loggins, Bruce Hornsby (vocals); Jesse Valenzuala (guitar, mandolin); Mike     
          Campbell (guitar, keyboards, bass); Waddy Wachtel, Dean Parks, Steve Lukather, Joe   
          Walsh, Danny Kortchmar, Mike Landau (guitar); Kenny G (soprano saxophone); Dave Koz  
          (saxophone); Benmont Tench (piano, organ); David Foster (piano); Bob Glaub, Duck     
          Dunn, Tony Levin (bass); Russ Kunkel, Stan Lynch (drums); Sharon Celani, Lori Perry, 
          Carolyn Brooks, Marilyn Martin, David Crosby (background vocals).                    
                                                                                               
          Producers include: Jimmy Lovine, Gordon Perry, Thom Panunzio, Stevie Nicks, Rupert   
          Hine.                                                                                
                                                                                               
          Includes liner notes by Danny Goldberg and Stevie Nicks. The accompanying 64-page    
          booklet contains lyrics, musician credits and previously unreleased photos.          
                                                                                               
          It makes sense that the first box set to come from a member of Fleetwood Mac is      
          Stevie Nicks&#039;. She has, after all, had the most successful career outside of The Mac.
          This box set spans her entire solo career in formidable fashion, and included is a   
          lavish booklet with extensive liner notes and many never-before-seen photos. Aside   
          from her solo career, the Mac gem "Rhiannon" (piano version) is included, along with 
          "Gold" (with John Stewart), "Whenever I Call You Friend" (with Kenny Loggins), and   
          "Long Distance Winner" (with Lindsey Buckingham). As for her solo work, hits from    
          "Bella Donna" to "Street Angel" are here, as well as B-sides, soundtrack cuts, and   
          demos. "Reconsider Me" (with Don Henley) is a fine ballad that compares with Stevie&#039;s
          best work. This is a comprehensive package that shows us just how much wonderful     
          music has been created outside of Stevie Nick&#039;s Fleetwood Mac tenure.                
                                                                                               
                                                                                               
                 Album opinion is taken from sites such as cduniverse and allmusic,            
                 HHI does not express an opinion either way with regard to the quality         
                 of the band etc. We hope you enjoy the music whatever it is!
